Definition:: The most common individual retirement account. Money is deposited in a 401(k) before income taxes are calculated.
Property left behind by a tenant on purpose and it appears that the former owner (or tenant) does not intend to come back for the property.
Spanish translation:: Bienes que dejó un inquilino a propósito, y aparentemente su dueño anterior (o inquilino) no tiene intención de volver para llevárselos.

Definition:: A rent or tax abatement is a reduction in the amount of rent or tax due.
To repeal or cancel an old law using another law or constitutional power.
The final ending of a marriage. Both parties are legally free to remarry.
Spanish translation:: La terminación definitiva de un matrimonio. Ambas partes tienen el derecho legal de volver a casarse.

Definition:: Summary of the court’s final decision. This includes how much money either person owes or any specific orders from the judge. This can be used to create a lien if you file it with the county recorder.
A provision in a contract or promissory note that if some specified event (like not making payments on time) occurs then the entire amount is due.
Spanish translation:: Una disposición (condición) de un contrato o pagaré que exige el pago completo de lo adeudado si ocurre cierto acontecimiento (como no pagar las cuotas puntualmente).

Definition:: Changing something that allow a person with special needs to use it as well as someone who doesn't have those needs.
Changes that allow a person with special needs to use it as well as someone who doesn't have those needs.
A person that helps someone else commit a crime. Can be on purpose or not.
The total amount of child support payments that you owe or that are late.
The person that is charged with a crime and has to go to criminal court.

A court form that the judgment creditor must fill out, sign, and file with the court when the judgment is fully paid. If no liens exist, the back of the Notice of Entry of Judgment can be signed and filed with the court.
When a judge or jury finds that the person on trial is not guilty.
A judge in the full-time service of the court. Compare to senior judge.
A case that is in court but isn't "settled" or "decided" has active status.
Spanish translation:: Un caso judicial está en estado activo cuando todavía no se llegó a un “acuerdo” ni se “decidió”.

Definition:: Money awarded by the court to compensate a party for loss or injury.
"For this lawsuit." Comes from Latin. A guardian ad litem is a person who helps another person during a court case.
Spanish translation:: “Para este caso". Viene del latín. Un tutor ad litem es una persona que ayuda a otra persona durante un caso.

Definition:: to make something better for a new use or purpose
A contract that is unfair and in favor of one party over the other. (contract of adhesion)
To put off a court hearing until another time or place.
When a judge hears and decides a case.
The judge’s decision in a case or action.
The way an executive government agency makes and enforces support orders without going to court.
A term used to describe evidence that may be considered by a jury or judge in civil and criminal cases.
Spanish translation:: Un término que se usa para describir las pruebas que pueden tener en cuenta un jurado o un juez en casos civiles o penales.

Definition:: Evidence that the judge can legally allow to be used in court.
To warn, advise, or scold.

What the judge says to the jury about: (1) what they must do and how they must behave, (2) what evidence they can use to make their decision (called "admissible" evidence), and (3) how they can use that evidence to make a decision.
Someone opposed to.
A lawsuit arising in or related to a bankruptcy case that begins by filing a complaint with the court, that is, a "trial" that takes place within the context of a bankruptcy case.

The system of trial practice in the United States and some other countries in which each of the opposing (or "adversary") parties has the opportunity to present and establish opposing positions before the court.
A person called to testify for the other side.
Making a case that you need something changed to allow you to use it as well as someone who doesn't have your specific needs.
A written statement that someone swears to under oath in front of someone that is legally authorized, like a judge or notary public.
Spanish translation:: Una declaración escrita en la que alguien jura ante una persona legalmente autorizada, como un juez o un notario público.

Definition:: When a defendant or person responding to a civil case has a reason that would make him or her "not guilty" or not at fault and gives the court new evidence to prove that. The defense has to prove what it says (called "burden of proof"). The defense has to explain this defense in their answer.
Spanish translation:: Cuando un acusado o persona que responde a un caso civil tiene una razón para ser declarado inocente o “no culpable” y le ofrece al tribunal nuevas pruebas para demostrarlo. La defensa tiene que probar lo que dice (llamado “carga de la prueba”). La defensa tiene que explicar esta defensa en la respuesta.

Definition:: A defense claim that the accused was somewhere else at the time a crime was committed.
Money the court orders you to pay to a spouse or ex spouse.
Spanish translation:: Dinero que el tribunal le ordena pagar a un cónyuge o ex cónyuge.

Definition:: A statement or claim that is made and hasn’t been proved to be true or false.
To say, declare, or charge that something is true even though it isn't proven yet.
Spanish translation:: Decir, declarar o acusar diciendo que algo es verdad aunque no se haya comprobado aún.

Definition:: To make better; to relieve
A juror selected in the same manner as a regular juror who hears all the evidence but does not help decide the case unless called on to replace a regular juror.
Methods of resolving disputes without official court proceedings. These methods include mediation and arbitration.
A procedure for settling a dispute outside the courtroom. Most forms of ADR are not binding, and involve referral of the case to a neutral party such as an arbitrator or mediator.
Someone that gives advice to the court about the law in a case, but isn't part of the case. Comes from the Latin for "friend of the court."
A legal action that says your marriage was never legally valid because of unsound mind, incest, bigamy, being too young to consent, fraud, force, or physical incapacity.
Spanish translation:: Una acción legal que dice que su matrimonio nunca fue válido legalmente debido a un defecto mental, incesto, bigamia, ser demasiado joven para dar consentimiento, fraude, coerción o incapacidad física.

Definition:: When someone’s name is kept secret.
Spanish translation:: Cuando se mantiene en secreto el nombre de alguien.

Definition:: Someone that appeals a court’s decision.
Having to do with appeals. An appellate court can review a lower court’s (called a "trial court" or "superior court") decision.
A court that can review how the law was used to decide a case in a lower court.
A person that answers an appeal in higher court.
When a person that isn't involved in the case looks at the evidence, hears the arguments, and makes a decision. Arbitration usually is a way to settle cases without doing a regular court case.
When a person that is accused of committing a crime is (a) taken to court, (b) told about the charges, and (c) asked to plead "guilty" or "not guilty".
Child support that is overdue or unpaid. A parent that has arrearages is "in arrears."
Spanish translation:: Monto de manutención de los hijos que está atrasado o sin pagar. Un padre que está atrasado en sus pagos “está en mora”.

Definition:: A federal judge who is appointed for life, during "good behavior," under Article III of the Constitution. Article III judges are nominated by the President and confirmed by the Senate.
Proved to be true.
Things that can be sold for a profit.
A person or business that is put in the place of the original creditor, such as a collection agency. You can assign your judgment to another person or business.

When a person that gets public assistance (money from the government) agrees to give the state any child support they get in the future. The person gets money and other benefits from the state. So the state can use part of the child support to pay for the cost of that public assistance.
A court order (made after a motion) that says a judgment debtor must assign certain rights to the judgment creditor.
A legal paper filed in a civil case that says the case is ready to go to trial.
The lawyer whose name is listed in a case record as representing someone in the case.
Phone system that gives information to people over the phone.
An injunction that automatically stops lawsuits, foreclosures, garnishments, and most collection activities against the debtor the moment a bankruptcy petition is filed.

A legal paper that you buy from a bondsman and give to the court instead of bail. The defendant signs it and is let go. But if they don't come to court when they're supposed to, they must pay the amount of money on the bail bond.
When you get your bail back. Or when a bail bondsman or insurance ("surety") company isn't responsible for your bail anymore.
A court order to let the court keep the bail deposit because the defendant didn’t go to court when they were supposed to.
A legal paper from the court that says the court will make a warrant for arrest unless the defendant goes to court or pays bail.
A written statement that the court gives a defendant that says bail was paid.
A list of the amount of bail that is recommended for different charges. In criminal cases, the court decides how much bail a defendant has to pay to be released.
A person that is in charge of security in the court.
Way to enforce a decision against someone that owes money. The money is taken from their checking or savings account at a bank, savings and loan, thrift institution, or credit union.

The legal way for a business or person to get help when they can't pay the money they owe. In bankruptcy court, they can get rid of debts by paying part of what they owe. There are special bankruptcy judges at these hearings.
Spanish translation:: La manera legal en que una empresa o persona puede obtener ayuda cuando no puede pagar el dinero que debe. Pueden ir al tribunal de quiebras para deshacerse de sus deudas pagando solo parte de lo que deben. En estas audiencias hay jueces especiales de quiebras.

Definition:: The informal name for title 11 of the United States Code (11 U.S.C. ￂﾧￂﾧ 101-1330), the federal bankruptcy law.
Spanish translation:: El nombre informal dado al Título 11 del Código de los Estados Unidos (11 U.S.C., secciones 101-1330), la ley federal de quiebras.

Definition:: The bankruptcy judges in regular active service in each district; a unit of the district court.
Spanish translation:: Los jueces de quiebras en servicio activo regular en cada distrito; una unidad del tribunal de distrito.

Definition:: All interests of the debtor in property at the time of the bankruptcy filing. The estate technically becomes the temporary legal owner of all of the debtor's property.
A judicial officer of the United States district court who is the court official with decision-making power over federal bankruptcy cases.
A formal request for the protection of the federal bankruptcy laws. (There is an official form for bankruptcy petitions.)
A private individual or corporation appointed in all Chapter 7 and Chapter 13 cases to represent the interests of the bankruptcy estate and the debtor's creditors.
Trial without a jury. The judge decides the case.
An order given by the judge (or "bench") to arrest a person
Spanish translation:: Una orden que da el juez (desde el “estrado”) para arrestar a una persona.
Spanish word:: orden de arresto desde el estrado

Definition:: People named in a will or financial product as receiving something when the owner dies.
Money and aid provided to someone with a need for it, like being a disaster survivor.

The standard that courts use to decide who will take care of the child. Some of the factors courts look at are: the age of the child, the health of the child, the emotional ties between the parents and the child, the ability of the parents to care for the child, and the child's ties to school, home, and the community.
Spanish translation:: El criterio utilizado por los tribunales para decidir quién se hará cargo del menor. Los tribunales se fijan en ciertos factores como: la edad y salud del menor, los lazos emocionales entre el menor y sus padres, la capacidad de los padres para cuidar al menor, y los lazos que tiene el menor con su escuela, su hogar y la comunidad.

Definition:: A judge’s decision before a trial that says there is enough evidence for a trial.
An account with a financial institution in which money or securities are placed. No person may withdraw funds from a blocked account without the court's permission.
Sincere, real, without fraud or deceit. Comes from the Latin for "in good faith."
A written language of raised dots which is used by people with vision difficulties.
Testing someone’s breath to see how much alcohol is in their blood.
When one person in the case has the responsibility to give more evidence than the other person.
Spanish translation:: Cuando una persona en el caso tiene la responsabilidad de presentar más pruebas que la otra persona.

Definition:: When someone unlawfully breaks into or enters a building or home, and they intend to or do commit a theft or other serious crime.
A bankruptcy case in which the debtor is a business or an individual involved in business and the debts are for business purposes.
A crime punishable by death.
Written text added to a video so people with hearing related disabilities can know what's being said.
A complete collection of every document filed in court in a case.
Identification number given to a case by the court.
Law made by earlier decisions that judges made in similar cases.
Spanish translation:: Derecho creado a partir de las decisiones anteriores tomadas por los jueces en casos similares.

Definition:: Identification number that the court clerk’s office gives a case. This number is on all papers filed in the case. Also called "case ID."
Spanish translation:: Número de identificación que el secretario del tribunal le da a un caso. Este número aparece en todos los documentos presentados en el caso. También se llama “identificación del caso”.

Definition:: How a case is managed from the first paper filed to the final decision.
The number of cases a judge has in a specific time.
The charges (or "counts") that make up the case or lawsuit.
A theory that says you buy things at your own risk. Comes from the Latin for "let the buyer beware."
A document with an official record of something. For example, a birth certificate is the official record of a child's birth.
An official copy of a paper from a case file that is marked as being true, complete, and a real copy of the original paper.
Reasons that a lawyer gives for removing a juror or judge from a case.
A judge’s office. Also usually where the judge’s clerks work.
When a civil or criminal case is moved from one court jurisdiction to another.
Spanish translation:: Cuando se transfiere un caso civil o penal de la jurisdicción de un tribunal a otra.

Definition:: A reorganization bankruptcy, usually involving a corporation or partnership.
The chapter of the Bankruptcy Code providing for adjustment of debts of a "family farmer" or "family fisherman," as the terms are defined in the Bankruptcy Code.
The chapter of the Bankruptcy Code providing for the adjustment of debts of an individual with regular income, often referred to as a "wage-earner" plan.
A person appointed to administer a Chapter 13 case.
The chapter of the Bankruptcy Code dealing with cases of cross-border insolvency.
The chapter of the Bankruptcy Code providing for "liquidation," that is, the sale of a debtor's nonexempt property and the distribution of the proceeds to creditors.
A person appointed in a Chapter 7 case to represent the interests of the bankruptcy estate and the creditors.

The chapter of the Bankruptcy Code providing for reorganization of municipalities (which includes cities and towns, as well as villages, counties, taxing districts, municipal utilities, and school districts).
A piece of personal property. Clothing, televisions, and cars are chattel. Chattel does not include a house or land.
The judge who has primary responsibility for the administration of a court; chief judges are determined by seniority.
Hurting a child physically, sexually or emotionally.
Spanish translation:: Causar daño a un menor en forma física, sexual o emocional.

Definition:: Someone appointed by the judge to help a child in a court case. The advocate can be a child welfare expert or a lawyer.

The rights and responsibilities between parents for their child(ren). A parenting plan must describe the legal custody and physical custody that is in the best interest of the children. This term is also often used to describe who the children live with.
Spanish translation:: Los derechos y las responsabilidades de los padres frente a su(s) hijo(s). Un plan de crianza tiene que indicar la custodia legal y custodia física que sean en el mejor interés de los menores. Este término también se usa con frecuencia para describir con quién viven los menores.

Definition:: An investigation into the health, safety, and welfare of children, usually in a custody or visitation case.
Child abuse and/or neglect.
Not taking good care of a child. Neglect can be physical or emotional.
Spanish translation:: No cuidar bien a un menor. El descuido puede ser físico o emocional.

Definition:: Money paid by a non-custodial parent to help support a child. Child support can also include other expenses, like paying to keep health insurance for the child.
Spanish translation:: Dinero pagado por un padre que no tiene la custodia para ayudar a mantener a su hijo. La manutención de los hijos también puede incluir otros gastos, como el seguro médico de su hijo.

Definition:: A legal proceeding in which one person (plaintiff) sues another (defendant) who has caused him injury or loss. The plaintiff seeks compensation from the defendant for his loss.
Spanish translation:: Un proceso legal en el cual una persona (el demandante) demanda a otra (el demandado) por haberle causado lesiones o pérdidas. El demandante quiere que el demandado lo indemnice por sus pérdidas.

Definition:: Rights guaranteed by the U.S. Bill of Rights, the 13th and 14th Amendments to the U.S. Constitution, including the right to due process, equal treatment under the law of all people regarding enjoyment of life, liberty, property, and protection.
Spanish translation:: Derechos garantizados por la Declaración de Derechos Constitucionales de EE.UU. (U.S. Bill of Rights) y las enmiendas 13 y 14 de la Constitución de EE.UU., como el derecho al debido proceso y el tratamiento equitativo en virtud de la ley de todas las personas en lo que hace al goce de la vida, la libertad, la propiedad y la protección.

Definition:: request for money under the terms of an insurance policy
A lawsuit in which one or more members of a large group, or class, of individuals or other entities sue on behalf of the entire class.
The court officer who oversees administrative functions, especially managing the flow of cases through the court. The clerk's office is often called a court's central nervous system.
Property that is promised as security for the satisfaction of a debt.
Spanish translation:: Bienes comprometidos como garantía para el cumplimiento de una deuda.

Definition:: The legal system that originated in England and is now in use in the United States, which relies on the articulation of legal principles in a historical succession of judicial decisions.
Spanish translation:: El sistema jurídico que se originó en Inglaterra y que se usa actualmente en los Estados Unidos; se basa en la creación de principios jurídicos en una sucesión histórica de decisiones judiciales.

Definition:: A special condition the court imposes that requires an individual to work  without pay  for a civic or non-profit organization.
Spanish translation:: Una condición especial impuesta por el tribunal que exige a un individuo que trabaje sin pago para una organización cívica o sin fines de lucro.
Spanish word:: servicio comunitario; servicio a la comunidad

Definition:: Prison terms for two or more offenses to be served at the same time, rather than one after the other.
Prison terms for two or more offenses to be served one after the other.
Someone who manages the estate of someone who is incapacitated.
A bankruptcy case filed to reduce or eliminate debts that are primarily consumer debts.
Debts incurred for personal, as opposed to business, needs.
A claim that may be owed by the debtor under certain circumstances, e.g., where the debtor is a cosigner on another person's loan and that person fails to pay.
A fee to a lawyer that you pay only if there is a successful result.
A judgment of guilt against a criminal defendant.
Spanish translation:: Un fallo que declara la culpabilidad de un acusado.

Definition:: A person who testifies for you and backs up your story. If you are asking the court to grant a divorce, you must bring to the hearing a witness who can corroborate your grounds for divorce.
Legal advice; a term also used to refer to the lawyers in a case.
Spanish translation:: Asesoramiento legal; un término que también se usa para referirse a los abogados de un caso.

Definition:: A person who makes a word-for-word record of what is said in court, generally by using a stenographic machine, shorthand or audio recording, and then produces a transcript of the proceedings upon request.
A person to whom or business to which the debtor owes money or that claims to be owed money by the debtor.
Spanish translation:: Una persona o empresa a quien el deudor le debe dinero, o que reclama que el deudor le debe dinero.

Definition:: Mental health assistance to help people cope with problems.
Latin, meaning "in fact" or "actually." Something that exists in fact but not as a matter of law.
Latin, meaning "in law." Something that exists by operation of law.
Latin, meaning "anew." A trial de novo is a completely new trial. Appellate review de novo implies no deference to the trial judge's ruling.
A person who has filed a petition for relief under the Bankruptcy Code.
Spanish translation:: Una persona que presentó una petición conforme al Código de Quiebras.

Definition:: A debtor's detailed description of how the debtor proposes to pay creditors' claims over a fixed period of time.
A judge's statement about someone's rights. For example, a plaintiff may seek a declaratory judgment that a particular statute, as written, violates some constitutional right.
An order by a court, ordering certain things.
Money that someone has to pay before an insurance company will start paying to fix something.
A document stating that someone owns a piece of property, and filed in an official record. Merely holding a deed does not grant ownership of a piece of land.
A judgment awarding a plaintiff the relief sought in the complaint because the defendant has failed to appear in court or otherwise respond to the complaint.
Spanish translation:: Un fallo que le reconoce al demandante la medida que solicitó en su demanda porque el demandado no compareció ante el tribunal o no respondió a la demanda de alguna otra manera.
Spanish word:: fallo por falta de comparecencia o en rebeldía

Definition:: An individual (or business) against whom a lawsuit is filed.
Spanish translation:: Un individuo (o empresa) contra quien se inicia un caso o una demanda.

Definition:: An oral statement made before an officer authorized by law to administer oaths. Such statements are often taken to examine potential witnesses, to obtain discovery, or to be used later in trial. See discovery.
A person who receives a gift of real property by a will.
A declaration made by the President that sets out what areas need help dealing with the impact of a disaster.
A status in which a debt cannot be collected.
A debt for which the Bankruptcy Code allows the debtor's personal liability to be eliminated.

A written document prepared by the chapter 11 debtor or other plan proponent that is designed to provide "adequate information" to creditors to enable them to evaluate the chapter 11 plan of reorganization.
Court action that prevents an identical lawsuit from being filed later.
Court action that allows the later filing.
Forced to move out of their home by a disaster.
Income not reasonably necessary for the maintenance or support of the debtor or dependents.
Disagreements.
Explicit disagreement of one or more judges of a court with the decision of the majority of the judges.
A log containing the complete history of each case in the form of brief chronological entries summarizing the court proceedings.
Number designation assigned to each case filed in a particular court

In criminal law, the constitutional guarantee that a defendant will receive a fair and impartial trial. In civil law, the legal rights of someone who confronts an adverse action threatening liberty or property.
Spanish translation:: En el derecho penal, la garantía constitucional de que un acusado recibirá un juicio equitativo e imparcial. En el derecho civil, los derechos legales de alguien que tiene un caso en su contra que amenaza su libertad o sus bienes.

Definition:: Legally allowed to receive.
Emancipation is when a parent gives up control over a minor child. Some states allow a child to sue to get a judge to declare the child emancipated.
Spanish translation:: Emancipación es cuando un padre renuncia al control que tiene sobre un hijo menor de edad. Algunos estados permiten que un menor inicie un caso para que un juez declare su emancipación.

Definition:: French, meaning "on the bench."
Pertaining to civil suits in "equity" rather than in "law." In English legal history, the courts of "law" could order the payment of damages and could afford no other remedy.
Spanish translation:: Se refiere a acciones civiles por “equidad” en vez de por “derecho”. En la historia jurídica inglesa, los tribunales de “derecho” podían ordenar el pago de daños y perjuicios, pero ningún otro tipo de remedio legal.

Definition:: A government order for people to leave a dangerous place to a safer place.
People who left their homes because of an evacuation order.
The legal process of forcing a person to leave a property.
Making someone leave a building or land. The most common legal eviction is a court case in which the landlord asks a judge for an order to make a tenant leave.
Spanish translation:: Obligar a alguien a que abandone un edificio o terreno. El desalojo legal más común es un caso judicial en el que el propietario le pide a un juez que le ordene al inquilino que se vaya.

Definition:: Evictions make people leave the home they live in. A legal eviction usually requires a judge to sign an eviction order or Warrant of Eviction.
Spanish translation:: Los desalojos obligan a la gente a dejar la casa en que viven. Un desalojo legal en general requiere que un juez firme una orden de desalojo.

Definition:: the action of taking a property when a person fails to keep up their property payments.
A proceeding brought before a court by one party only, without notice to or challenge by the other side.
Spanish translation:: Un procedimiento legal iniciado en el tribunal por una parte solamente, sin dar aviso ni permitir a la otra parte que se oponga.

Definition:: Doctrine that says evidence obtained in violation of a criminal defendant's constitutional or statutory rights is not admissible at trial.
Provision or clause which excuses someone from responsibility.
Evidence indicating that a defendant did not commit the crime.
Contracts or leases under which both parties to the agreement have duties remaining to be performed.
Property that a debtor is allowed to retain, free from the claims of creditors who do not have liens on the property.
Spanish translation:: Bienes que el deudor puede retener y que no quedan sujetos a los reclamos de los acreedores que no tengan un derecho de retención sobre ellos.

Definition:: Certain property owned by an individual debtor that the Bankruptcy Code or applicable state law permits the debtor to keep from unsecured creditors.
Spanish translation:: Cierta propiedad o bienes de un deudor individual que el Código de Quiebras o las leyes estatales pertinentes le permiten retener de los acreedores sin garantía.

Definition:: A bankruptcy case filed either without schedules or with incomplete schedules listing few creditors and debts. (Face sheet filings are often made for the purpose of delaying an eviction or foreclosure.)
A way to challenge a decision by DSS that you disagree with. They will provide a judge to listen to your problem and decide what action should be taken.
Spanish translation:: Una manera de disputar una decisión de DSS con la que no está de acuerdo. Las audiencias imparciales son administradas por la Oficina de Ayuda Temporal y Discapacidades del Estado de Nueva York. Un juez considerará su problema y decidirá qué medida se debe tomar al respecto.

Definition:: The amount for which an item can be sold on the open market by a willing seller to a willing buyer.
Spanish translation:: La cantidad de dinero por la que un vendedor dispuesto puede vender un objeto en el mercado abierto a un comprador dispuesto.

Definition:: An individual, individual and spouse, corporation, or partnership engaged in a farming operation that meets certain debt limits and other statutory criteria for filing a petition under Chapter 12.
An attorney employed by the federal courts on a full-time basis to provide legal defense to defendants who are unable to afford counsel.
As provided for in the Criminal Justice Act, an organization established within a federal judicial circuit to represent criminal defendants who cannot afford an adequate defense.
Jurisdiction given to federal courts in cases involving the interpretation and application of the U.S. Constitution, acts of Congress, and treaties.
A serious crime, usually punishable by at least one year in prison.
Spanish translation:: Un delito mayor, que en general se castiga por lo menos con un año en prisión.

Definition:: Entering a document into the official record.
Part of a house that's permanently installed, like a faucet or a ceiling fan.
The legal process that a lender uses to take possession of property when the borrower has not made mortgage payments. Banks use foreclosure to remove borrowers from their homes.
Spanish translation:: El proceso legal utilizado por un prestamista para tomar posesión de una propiedad cuando el prestatario no ha efectuado sus pagos hipotecarios. Los bancos usan la ejecución hipotecaria para sacar a los prestatarios de sus casas.

Definition:: the action of taking a property when a person fails to keep up their property payments.
A transfer of a debtor's property made with intent to defraud or for which the debtor receives less than the transferred property's value.
A procedure whereby the Court has the defendant's bank account seized and the money paid to the plaintiff to satisfy the judgment.
A procedure whereby a portion of the defendant's wages are deducted regularly and paid to the plaintiff to satisfy a judgment.

A body of 16-23 citizens who listen to evidence of criminal allegations, which is presented by the prosecutors, and determine whether there is probable cause to believe an individual committed an offense.

The legal basis for a divorce. The law sets out specific circumstances under which a divorce will be granted. Before the court will grant a divorce, the person seeking the divorce must prove that those conditions exist.
A person who has been appointed by a judge to take care of a child or incompetent adult.
Spanish translation:: La persona nombrada por un juez para cuidar a un menor o un adulto incapaz.

Definition:: A person appointed by the court only to take legal action on behalf of a minor or an adult not able to handle his/her own affairs. Duties may include filing a lawsuit for an injured child, defending a lawsuit or filing a claim against an estate.

Latin, meaning "you have the body." A writ of habeas corpus generally is a judicial order forcing law enforcement authorities to produce a prisoner they are holding, and to justify the prisoner's continued confinement.
Evidence presented by a witness who did not see or hear the incident in question but heard about it from someone else. With some exceptions, hearsay generally is not admissible as evidence at trial.
One who acquires property upon the death of another, based on the rules of descent and distribution or by the terms of the will.
A handwritten Will.
A special condition the court imposes that requires an individual to remain at home except for certain approved activities such as work and medical appointments.
a direct phone line set up for a specific purpose, especially for use in emergencies
A dispute between a landlord and renter.
Official papers that prove you are who you say you are, like a driver's license.
Someone's status as an immigrant, whether documented, not documented.
The process of calling a witness's testimony into doubt.
Latin, meaning in a judge's chambers. Often means outside the presence of a jury and the public. In private.
"In the manner of a pauper." Permission given by the court to a person to file a case without payment of the required court fees because the person cannot pay them.
Literally means "in place of a parent." It is a term used for someone who is acting in place of a parent.
In the matter of.
A person has an injury, illness, or some other condition that prevents them from making decisions for themselves.
money received, especially on a regular basis, for work or through investments.
Evidence indicating that a defendant did commit the crime.
The formal charge issued by a grand jury stating that there is enough evidence that the defendant committed the crime to justify having a trial; it is used primarily for felonies.
An account with a mutual fund that invests money for a person to use when they retire.
Whatever one receives upon the death of a relative due to the laws of descent and distribution or by the terms of the will.
Spanish translation:: Lo que uno recibe al fallecimiento de un pariente, dispuesto por las leyes sucesorias o por los términos del testamento.

Definition:: A court order preventing one or more named parties from taking some action. A preliminary injunction often is issued to allow fact-finding, so a judge can determine whether a permanent injunction is justified.
A routine payment required by some kind of loan or mortgage.
A way to manage risk. Insurance uses a shared pool of money to pay out claims.
A request for payment sent to an insurance company.
A form of discovery consisting of written questions to be answered in writing and under oath.
When a person dies without leaving a valid will.
Spanish translation:: Cuando una persona fallece sin dejar un testamento válido.

Definition:: A list of your belongings that includes evidence of their value.
A court-approved mechanism under which two or more cases can be administered together.
One bankruptcy petition filed by a husband and wife together.
The position of judge. By statute, Congress authorizes the number of judgeships for each district and appellate court.

The legal authority of a court to hear and decide a certain type of case. It also is used as a synonym for venue, meaning the geographic area over which the court has territorial jurisdiction to decide cases.
Spanish translation:: La autoridad jurídica de un tribunal para considerar y decidir cierto tipo de caso. También se usa como sinónimo de jurisdicción territorial, o sea el área geográfica sobre la cual el tribunal tiene competencia para decidir casos.

Definition:: The study of law and the structure of the legal system.
A judge's directions to the jury before it begins deliberations regarding the factual questions it must answer and the legal rules that it must apply.
A person who rents land, a building, or an apartment to a tenant.
Spanish translation:: Una persona que alquila un terreno, un edificio o un departamento a un inquilino.

Definition:: A business formed by one or more lawyers to engage in the practice of law.
Spanish translation:: Una organización formada por uno o más abogados para dedicarse al ejercicio del derecho.

Definition:: A legal action started by a plaintiff against a defendant based on a complaint that the defendant failed to perform a legal duty which resulted in harm to the plaintiff.
Spanish translation:: Una acción legal iniciada por un demandante en contra de un demandado debido a que este último no cumplió con un deber legal, lo cual le causó daño al demandante.

Definition:: An oral or written agreement, express or implied, which creates a landlord-tenant relationship.
Spanish translation:: Un acuerdo oral o escrito, expreso o implícito, que crea una relación de propietario a inquilino.

Definition:: A document allowing you to live in a home owned by a landlord.
A lease that contains a clause that gives the tenant some power, either qualified or unqualified, to buy the landlord's interest in the property.
The right of a parent to make important decisions in the child’s life.
Spanish translation:: El derecho de un padre a tomar decisiones importantes sobre la vida del menor.

Definition:: A court-decree right to not live with your spouse, but with the rights/obligations of divorced persons.
Someone, usually a bank, that lends money.
The renter of the property (the tenant).
The owner of the property (your landlord).
A document authorizing another person to act as one's agent.
A computerized full-text legal database.
Legal responsibility for one's acts or omissions.
Spanish translation:: La obligación legal de responder por los actos u omisiones propios.

Definition:: Insurance that specifically covers the risk of getting sued in court.
A person who lives in apartment who is not a tenant and unrelated to the tenant, but is allowed to stay there because a tenant allows it.
A claim against property that may be used to repay a debt.
Spanish translation:: Un reclamo contra una propiedad que se puede usar para pagar una deuda.

Definition:: Establishes certain legal responsibilities while the parties are separated but does not end the marriage.
A creditor's claim for a fixed amount of money.
A specific sum of money which has been agreed upon by the parties to a lease (or other contract) as the amount of damages to be paid by a party who has breached the agreement.
The sale of a debtor's property with the proceeds to be used for the benefit of creditors.
Spanish translation:: La venta de una propiedad del deudor, cuyos fondos se usarán para beneficio de los acreedores.

Definition:: Any party to a lawsuit. It does not include the judge, witnesses or attorneys.
Spanish translation:: Cualquiera de las partes de una demanda. No incluye al juez, los testigos ni los abogados.

Definition:: A case, controversy, or lawsuit. Participants (plaintiffs and defendants) in lawsuits are called litigants.
Spanish translation:: Un caso, controversia, o pleito. Los participantes (demandantes y demandados) del pleito se llaman litigantes.

Definition:: A living will usually states that if you are terminally ill, then death-delaying procedures shall not be used to prolong your life. It also can authorize a person to make health care decisions for you if you become incapacitated.
Spanish translation:: Un testamento en vida, o documento de voluntad anticipada, generalmente se usa para decir que si usted tiene una enfermedad terminal no quiere que se usen procedimientos para demorar su muerte. También puede autorizar a una persona a tomar decisiones sobre su atención de la salud si usted queda incapacitado.
Spanish word:: testamento en vida/documento de voluntad anticipada

Definition:: A company that buys debt from a lender, usually for pennies on the dollar, with the intention of collecting the money owed.

A judicial officer of a district court who conducts initial proceedings in criminal cases, decides criminal misdemeanor cases, conducts many pretrial civil and criminal matters on behalf of district judges, and decides civil cases with the consent of the parties.
All property either spouse bought during the marriage. It does not matter whose name is on the title.
Spanish translation:: Todos los bienes que cualquiera de los cónyuges compró durante el matrimonio. No importa a nombre de quién están los bienes.

Definition:: A breach (violation, failure to perform) which is important, substantial, not trivial.
Section 707(b)(2) of the Bankruptcy Code applies a "means test" to determine whether an individual debtor's chapter 7 filing is presumed to be an abuse of the Bankruptcy Code.
Spanish translation:: La sección 707(b)(2) del Código de Quiebras usa una “prueba de insuficiencia de medios” para determinar si la presentación de un deudor conforme al capítulo 7 se puede considerar un abuso del Código de Quiebras.

Definition:: Process of alternative dispute resolution in which a neutral third party, the mediator, assists two or more parties in order to help them negotiate an agreement.
Spanish translation:: Proceso de resolución alternativa de conflictos en el que una tercera parte neutral, el mediador, asiste a dos o más partes para ayudarles a negociar un acuerdo.

Definition:: Brief holding of the whole court with the opinion limited or omitted.
Special condition the court imposes to require an individual to undergo evaluation and treatment for a mental disorder.
An offense punishable by one year of imprisonment or less.
Spanish translation:: Una infracción que se castiga con un año de prisión o menos.

Definition:: An invalid trial, caused by fundamental error. When a mistrial is declared, the trial must start again with the selection of a new jury.
A decision by a court that you owe money is called a money judgment.
A pledge of specific property as security for the payment of a debt. The mortgagor is the person who pledges the property. The mortgagee accepts the pledge.
Spanish translation:: Una promesa de entregar una propiedad específica como garantía del pago de una deuda. El deudor hipotecario es la persona que promete entregar la propiedad. El acreedor hipotecario es el que acepta la promesa.

Definition:: A pretrial motion requesting the court to prohibit the other side from presenting, or even referring to, evidence on matters said to be so highly prejudicial that no steps taken by the judge can prevent the jury from being unduly influenced.

Word:: motion to lift the automatic stay
Definition:: A request by a creditor to allow the creditor to take action against the debtor or the debtor's property that would otherwise be prohibited by the automatic stay.
Wills made by two people (usually spouses, but could be "partners") in which each gives his/her estate to the other.
A Chapter 7 case in which there are no assets available to satisfy any portion of the creditors' unsecured claims.
No contest. A plea of nolo contendere has the same effect as a plea of guilty, as far as the criminal sentence is concerned, but may not be considered as an admission of guilt for any other purpose.
A debt that cannot be eliminated in bankruptcy.
Property of a debtor that can be liquidated to satisfy claims of creditors.
Food that doesn't spoil quickly or easily. For example, canned food.
A charitable company set up to run without making a profit at the end of a year.
Charitable companies set up to run without making a profit at the end of a year.
A person authorized by the state to give oaths.
Spanish translation:: Una persona autorizada por el estado a prestar juramento.

Definition:: A notice to a borrower with property as collateral that he/she is delinquent in payments.
A paper that tells you the time, date, and place of a court appearance in an eviction case.
A written notice given by landlord to tenant, indicating that tenant must move from the premises at a time designated.
A swearing to tell the truth, which would subject the oath-taker to liability for perjury if she knowingly told a lie.
Spanish translation:: Una promesa de decir la verdad, y que responsabiliza a la persona juramentada por perjurio si mintió a sabiendas.

Definition:: A trustee's or creditor's objection to the debtor being released from personal liability for certain dischargeable debts.
A trustee's or creditor's objection to the debtor's attempt to claim certain property as exempt from liquidation by the trustee to creditors.
Someone living in a residence or using premises, as a tenant or owner. 2) a person who takes possession of real property or a thing which has no known owner, intending to gain ownership.
An opportunity for lawyers to summarize their position before the court and also to answer the judges' questions.
The local legislation of a city, town, village, or county written by the local legislative body.
Spanish translation:: La legislación local de una ciudad, pueblo, municipalidad o condado, dictada por el órgano legislativo local.

Definition:: A party who has standing to be heard by the court in a matter to be decided in the bankruptcy case.
Latin, meaning "for the court." In appellate courts, often refers to an unsigned opinion.
A district court may grant each side in a civil or criminal trial the right to exclude a certain number of prospective jurors without cause or giving a reason.
Something that can spoil or "go bad," usually food.
The crime of intentionally lying after taking an oath to tell the truth by a notary public, court clerk or other official.
Spanish translation:: El delito de mentir intencionalmente después de haber jurado decir la verdad ante un notario público, el secretario del tribunal u otro funcionario.

Definition:: Movable property or possessions, as distinguished from real property.
Spanish translation:: Un bien o posesión mueble, a diferencia de una propiedad inmueble.

Definition:: Usually, the executor or administrator of a deceased person.
A group of citizens who hear the evidence presented by both sides at trial and determine the facts in dispute.
A business not authorized to practice law that prepares bankruptcy petitions.
Applications for assistance. Also, the documents used to start some court cases.
A federal misdemeanor punishable by six months or less in prison.
This is where a child is supposed to live. Legal custody is different than physical custody. Legal custody is about who can make decisions for the child.
Spanish translation:: Donde un hijo debería vivir. La custodia legal es distinta de la custodia física. La custodia legal indica quién puede tomar decisiones por el hijo.

Definition:: A person or business that files a formal complaint with the court.
Spanish translation:: La persona o empresa que presenta una demanda formal ante el tribunal.

Definition:: Written statements filed with the court that describe a party's legal or factual assertions about the case.
Spanish translation:: Declaraciones escritas presentadas ante el tribunal que describen las afirmaciones legales o sobre los hechos de una de las partes del caso.

Definition:: A transfer of the debtor's property made after the commencement of the case.

A document that gives someone authority to act on your behalf on matters that you specify. The person who acts on behalf of someone else is called the agent (also called the attorney-in-fact). The person who has given the authority to the agent is called the principal.
Spanish translation:: Un documento que le otorga a alguien autorización para actuar en su nombre en asuntos específicos. La persona que actúa en nombre de otra es su representante (o también mandatario o apoderado). La persona que le da la autorización al apoderado se llama mandante o poderdante.

Definition:: The arrangement (or rearrangement) of a debtor's property to allow the debtor to take maximum advantage of exemptions.
A court decision in an earlier case with facts and legal issues similar to a dispute currently before a court.

A debt payment made to a creditor in the 90-day period before a debtor files bankruptcy (or within one year if the creditor was an insider) that gives the creditor more than the creditor would receive in the debtor's chapter 7 case.
Money you pay for insurance coverage.
A report prepared by a court's probation officer, after a person has been convicted of an offense, summarizing for the court the background information needed to determine the appropriate sentence.
A meeting of the judge and lawyers to plan the trial, to discuss which matters should be presented to the jury, to review proposed evidence and witnesses, and to set a trial schedule.

A function of the federal courts that takes place at the very start of the criminal justice process after a person has been arrested and charged with a federal crime and before he or she goes to trial.
Raising prices to get more money from people because of a disaster or shortage.
Presumed to be true unless disproved by contrary evidence.
The primary caretaker is the parent who spends the most time with the child, and is the parent the child first turns to if they need something
An unsecured claim that is entitled to be paid ahead of other unsecured claims that are not entitled to priority status. Priority refers to the order in which these unsecured claims are to be paid.
A slang expression sometimes used to refer to a pro se litigant. It is a corruption of the Latin phrase "in propria persona."
Representing oneself. Serving as one's own lawyer.
Spanish translation:: Que se representa a sí mismo. Actuar como su propio abogado.

Definition:: Temporary.
The process of proving a will is valid and then doing what was stated in the Will.
Spanish translation:: El proceso de probar que un testamento es válido y después hacer lo que dice el testamento.

Definition:: Sentencing option in the federal courts.
Spanish translation:: Una opción de condena en los tribunales federales.

Definition:: Officers of the probation office of a court. Probation officer duties include conducting presentence investigations, preparing presentence reports on convicted defendants, and supervising released defendants.

Any person over 18, not directly involved in the case, who will deliver the Summons and a copy of the plaintiffs Complaint, and later return to the Court an affidavit that he or she has completed service.
Spanish translation:: Cualquier persona mayor de 18 años de edad que no esté involucrada en el caso y que entrega la citación y una copia de la demanda, y después proporciona al tribunal una declaración jurada de que realizó la entrega.
Spanish word:: notificador legal; persona que entrega documentos legales

Definition:: A written statement describing the reason a debtor owes a creditor money, which typically sets forth the amount of money owed.
All legal or equitable interests of the debtor in property as of the commencement of the case.
Spanish translation:: Todos los intereses legales o patrimoniales del deudor en propiedad al comienzo del caso.

Definition:: To charge someone with a crime. A prosecutor tries a criminal case on behalf of the government.
Non-criminal order obtained by abused spouse against abusive spouse.
Spanish translation:: Orden no penal obtenida por un cónyuge abusado contra un cónyuge abusivo.

Definition:: Eligible or allowed to receive benefits.
Someone who moved to the United States and is allowed to receive benefits.
A disaster loss that makes someone eligible for certain benefits from the IRS.
Someone who moved to the United States and is allowed to receive benefits.
A real property deed that transfers only the interest in the property in which the grantor has claim to.

An agreement by a debtor to continue paying a dischargeable debt after the bankruptcy, usually for the purpose of keeping collateral or mortgaged property that would otherwise be subject to repossession.
Land. For example, a house or farm.
Land. For example, a house or farm.
On appeal, the record consists of a transcript of all or a portion of the proceedings in lower courts, including testimony, pleadings, opinions, etc.
To send back; return of a case by an appellate court to the trial court for further proceedings.
An attempt to try again to serve the defendant with the Summons and Complaint
A payment from someone, often a government entity, that helps pay someone's rent.
The thing has been decided.
To annul, cancel, terminate a contract, including a lease, and to restore the parties to the position they would occupy if no contract had been made.

A temporary order of a court to keep conditions as they are (like not taking a child out of the county or not selling marital property) until there can be a hearing in which both parties are present. More properly it is called a temporary restraining order (shortened to TRO).
A legal entity that holds assets, in a way that allows them to be distributed to beneficiaries without probate.

A secured creditor is an individual or business that holds a claim against the debtor that is secured by a lien on property of the estate. The property subject to the lien is the secured creditor's collateral.

Debt backed by a mortgage, pledge of collateral, or other lien; debt for which the creditor has the right to pursue specific pledged property upon default. Examples include home mortgages, auto loans and tax liens.
An amount of money given to the landlord that can be used to cover unpaid rent, damages, or cleaning.
Spanish translation:: Una cantidad de dinero que se da al propietario y que se puede usar para cubrir alquileres impagos, daños o gastos de limpieza.

Definition:: A federal judge who, after attaining the requisite age and length of judicial experience, takes senior status, thus creating a vacancy among a court's active judges.
A set of rules and principles established by the United States Sentencing Commission that trial judges use to determine the sentence for a convicted defendant.

Property that one of the spouses owned before the marriage. Any inheritance one spouse gets, even during marriage, is separate property. So are personal gifts (unless they came from the other spouse) and payments for personal injuries.
Spanish translation:: Un bien que uno de los cónyuges tenía antes del matrimonio. Cualquier herencia recibida por uno de los cónyuges, aun durante el matrimonio, es bien por separado. También lo son las donaciones personales (a menos que hayan provenido del otro cónyuge) y pagos por lesiones personales.

Definition:: An oral or written agreement to live apart, entered into by a married couple.
To separate. Sometimes juries are sequestered from outside influences during their deliberations.
The delivery of writs or summonses to the appropriate party.
Spanish translation:: La entrega de escritos o citaciones a la parte apropiada.
Spanish word:: entrega de proceso o aviso legal

Definition:: A special type of chapter 11 case in which there is no creditors' committee (or the creditors' committee is deemed inactive by the court) and in which the debtor is subject to more oversight by the U.S. trustee than other chapter 11 debtors.
Customer- owned companies set up to assist farmers market leverage.
Husband or wife.
Spanish translation:: Esposo o esposa.

Definition:: Someone who settles on the property of another, without legal authority to do so and without the consent of the person who has the right of possession of the property.
Degree of proof required. In criminal cases, prosecutors must prove a defendant's guilt "beyond a reasonable doubt."
The doctrine that decisions should stand as precedents for guidance in future cases.
A series of questions the debtor must answer in writing concerning sources of income, transfers of property, lawsuits by creditors, etc. (There is an official form a debtor must use.)
A declaration made by a chapter 7 debtor concerning plans for dealing with consumer debts that are secured by property of the estate.
A law passed by a legislature.
Spanish translation:: Una ley aprobada por una legislatura.

Definition:: The time within which a lawsuit must be filed or a criminal prosecution begun. The deadline can vary, depending on the type of civil case or the crime charged.
Spanish translation:: El plazo en el que se debe presentar una demanda o iniciar una causa penal. Este plazo puede variar según el tipo de caso civil o el delito del cual se acusa.

Definition:: Latin, meaning "of its own will." Often refers to a court taking an action in a case without being asked to do so by either side.
When you allow someone else to take over your lease for a certain period of time after which you agree take responsibility for the lease again.
The act or process by which a person's rights or claims are ranked below those of others.
A command, issued under a court's authority, to a witness to appear and give testimony.
Spanish translation:: Una orden emitida en virtud de la autoridad de un tribunal para que comparezca un testigo y preste testimonio.

Definition:: A command to a witness to appear and produce documents.
Money granted by a government agency to keep a price low. In housing programs, a subsidy is often money paid to a landlord for part of a tenant's rent.
Spanish translation:: Dinero dado por una entidad gubernamental para mantener un precio bajo. En programas de vivienda, un subsidio frecuentemente es dinero que se paga a un propietario como parte del alquiler de un inquilino.

Definition:: Government funding to support a person or business.
A special condition the court imposes that requires an individual to undergo testing and treatment for abuse of illegal drugs, prescription drugs, or alcohol.
The characterization of a bankruptcy case filed by an individual whose debts are primarily consumer debts where the court finds that the granting of relief would be an abuse of chapter 7
Putting the assets and liabilities of two or more related debtors into a single pool to pay creditors.
A decision made on the basis of statements and evidence presented for the record without a trial.
Term of supervision served after a person is released from prison.
Someone who was impacted by a disaster.
Income that the IRS considers taxable. Not all sources of income are taxable income.
Akin to a preliminary injunction, it is a judge's short-term order forbidding certain actions until a full hearing can be conducted. Often referred to as a TRO.
The tenant's exclusive right, created by a rental agreement between the landlord and the tenant, to use and possess the landlord's rental unit.
Spanish translation:: El derecho exclusivo del inquilino, creado por el acuerdo de alquiler entre el propietario y el inquilino, a usar y poseer la unidad de alquiler del propietario.

Definition:: A person who has the legal right to live in or use a property.
Spanish translation:: Una persona que tiene el derecho legal de vivir en o usar una propiedad

Definition:: A person who rents a home from a landlord.
People who rent a house or apartment from a landlord.
Clauses in a rental agreement that say when a landlord or tenant can cancel it.
The end of a lease or other contract.
A person who has written a will.
Spanish translation:: Una persona que ha escrito un testamento.

Definition:: Evidence presented orally by witnesses during trials or before grand juries.
Spanish translation:: Pruebas presentadas oralmente por testigos durante juicios o ante jurados de acusación.

Definition:: A claim filed by a defendant who feels that some third party (not yet involved in the case) is responsible and owes him or her money that should be used to satisfy any judgment the plaintiff may win from the defendant.
A civil, not criminal, wrong. A negligent or intentional injury against a person or property, with the exception of breach of contract.
A wrongful entry, whether with force or peacefully, onto the property of another.
A group of citizens who hear the evidence presented by both sides at trial and determine the facts in dispute.
A legal entity that holds assets.
A business not authorized to practice law that prepares bankruptcy petitions.
A lawyer appointed by the President in each judicial district to prosecute and defend cases for the federal government.
An officer of the U.S. Department of Justice responsible for supervising the administration of bankruptcy cases, estates, and trustees
When the defendant is not going to try to stop the divorce and there are no issues for the court to decide about children, money, or property.
Spanish translation:: Cuando el demandado no va a tratar de parar el proceso de divorcio y el tribunal no tiene asuntos que decidir sobre los hijos, dinero o bienes.

Definition:: A debt secured by property that is worth less than the amount of the debt.
The most widely used test for evaluating undue hardship in the dischargeability of a student loan.
The amount of pressure that someone uses to force another to execute a will leaving assets in a particular way, to make a direct gift while alive or to sign a contract.
Spanish translation:: La cantidad de presión que alguien usa para obligar a otra a firmar un testamento que distribuya los activos de una cierta manera, hacer una donación mientras esté con vida o firmar un contrato.

Definition:: A lawsuit brought by a landlord against a tenant to evict the tenant from rental property  usually for nonpayment of rent.
A claim for which a specific value has not been determined.
A debt that should have been listed by the debtor in the schedules filed with the court but was not.
A claim or debt for which a creditor holds no special assurance of payment.
A rate of interest on a debt that is in excess of the percentage allowed by law. Also called "loan-sharking."
The decision of a jury after a trial, which must be accepted by the trial judge to be final. A judgment by a judge without a jury is not called a verdict.
Jury selection process of questioning prospective jurors, to ascertain their qualifications and determine any basis for challenge.
The living apart for 12 months of a married couple who agrees to separate.
A transfer of a debtor's property with the debtor's consent.
A nonbankruptcy legal proceeding whereby a plaintiff or creditor seeks to subject to his or her claim the future wages of a debtor.
Spanish translation:: Un procedimiento legal fuera de la ley de quiebras por el cual un demandante o acreedor trata de sujetar su reclamo al sueldo futuro de un deudor.

Definition:: An order of the court requiring that a specific person be restored to his original position.
A written court order directing a person to take, or refrain from taking, a certain act.
Spanish translation:: Una orden del tribunal mediante la que se instruye a una persona que tome, o deje de tomar, una medida en particular.

Definition:: A court order directing a sheriff (or other law enforcement officer) to seize property of a defendant to satisfy a judgment.
An order issued by the U.S. Supreme Court directing the lower court to transmit records for a case which it will hear on appeal.
An order of the court directed to the sheriff, requiring him to enter the property and give possession of it to the person entitled to it by judgment of the court.
A form issued by the court directing a party to respond to a complaint, motion, or petition.
